summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Counselor (Unrated Extended Cut) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2014/02/15 Store: Michael Fassbender (Actor), Penelope Cruz (Actor), Ridley Scott (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['Counselor(Br+Dc)'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Javier Bardem, Brad Pitt, Ridley Scott, Michael Fassbender, Penelope Cruz, Cameron Diaz', 'Language': 'English', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '28928514', 'Director': 'Ridley Scott', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'February 11, 2014', 'Actors': 'Michael Fassbender, Penelope Cruz, Brad Pitt, Javier Bardem, Cameron Diaz', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: I loved the theatrical release, so I was pleased to see this expanded version. It is visually beautiful, with mesmerizing dialogue and very strong performances, even in the smaller roles. The film is unsettling, with a vague air of menace throughout. The extra quarter-hour or so of scenes on the blu-ray version are worth it, and deepen the immersive experience. This is not your typical Hollywood film; those who expect the usual "realism" of exploding buildings and fast car chases are going to be disappointed by the hyperrealism of this film. It is polarizing, of course, but do yourself a favor and make up your own mind. Review Title: Brilliant movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/09/13 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lenny Abrahamson'], 'Producers': ['Ed Guiney', 'David Barron', 'Stevie Lee'], 'Starring': ['Domhnall Gleeson', 'Maggie Gyllenhaal', 'Scoot McNairy'], 'Studio': ['Magnolia']} Review Text: I watched this film, then watched it again. It's beautiful, funny, and poignant. The performances by all the main characters are good--Gyllenhaal is fierce, Gleeson is likable even in his mistakes, McNairy is appropriately defensive and a little frantic. Fassbender is unbelievable. Review Title: It's beautiful, funny Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/11/01 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Billy Wilder'], 'Producers': ['Buddy G. DeSylva', 'Joseph Sistrom'], 'Starring': ['Fred MacMurray', 'Barbara Stanwyck', 'Edward G. Robinson'], 'Studio': ['NBC Universal']} Review Text: Classic Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/02/09 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Danny Boyle'], 'Producers': ['Mark Gordon', 'Guymon Casady', 'Scott Rudin', 'Danny Boyle', 'Christian Colson'], 'Starring': ['Michael Fassbender', 'Kate Winslet', 'Seth Rogen'], 'Studio': ['UNIVERSAL PAY TELEVISION']} Review Text: Engrossing performances, especially by Michael Fassbender, Jeff Daniels, and Seth Rogen; witty script; fast-moving. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/01/17 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Ferland', 'Scott Brazil', 'Clark Johnson', 'Dean White', 'Stephen Kay'], 'Producers': ['Shawn Ryan'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} Review Text: One of the all-time great shows. All the one-star reviews have popped up on here because it was apparently removed from Amazon Prime, but that's a terrible way to register a protest against availability.
Exciting action, deep involvement with the characters, domestic lives (for Vic and Shane, especially) that don't feel tacked on but rather intrinsic to understanding the characters: it's up there with Breaking Bad, and has aged better than Dexter, as one of the best long-format dramas in television. Review Title: One of the Best Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Light Between Oceans Review Date: 2017/01/24 Store: Michael Fassbender (Actor), Alicia Vikander (Actor), Derek Cianfrance (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Lighthouse keeper Tom Sherbourne (Michael Fassbender) and radiant, spirited Isabel (Alicia Vikander) live together in married bliss on a remote, rugged island off the coast of Australia. But their windswept world is turned upside down when Isabel learns that she's unable to bear a child. One day, a drifting lifeboat washes ashore with a crying baby in it. The dilemma the couple now face will echo far beyond the island, engulfing and irrevocably impacting their world -- and that of a stranger (Rachel Weisz) -- in a passionate story about love, hope, and a fateful choice. Get swept away by this stunning film, with an exclusive bonus Audio Commentary that will pull you deeper in."] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Caren Pistorius, Screenplay By Derek Cianfrance, Florence Clery, Anthony Hayes, Michael Fassbender, Derek Cianfrance, Rachel Weisz, Emily Barclay, Based On The Novel By M.L. Stedman, Alicia Vikander, Leon Ford, Bryan Brown, Jack ThompsonCaren Pistorius, Screenplay By Derek Cianfrance, Florence Clery, Anthony Hayes, Michael Fassbender, Derek Cianfrance, Rachel Weisz, Emily Barclay, Based On The Novel By M.L. Stedman, Alicia Vikander, Leon Ford, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson See more', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD High Res Audio)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 13 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43381792', 'Director': 'Derek Cianfrance', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 13 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 24, 2017', 'Actors': 'Michael Fassbender, Alicia Vikander, Rachel Weisz, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'TOUCHSTONE PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Screenplay By Derek Cianfrance, Based On The Novel By M.L. Stedman', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I saw this movie when it was released, and I'm looking forward to getting the DVD.
For me, this was the best film of the year. Why the critics slammed it, I have no idea. If you missed the film in theaters, don't miss it now. Review Title: this was the best film of the year Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchasing data reveals a strong preference for high-quality cinema, particularly films featuring compelling narratives and standout performances, especially from Michael Fassbender. Ratings consistently hover around 4.3 to 5.0, indicating high satisfaction. Reviews often highlight emotional depth and character intricacies, suggesting a genuine appreciation for drama and storytelling over action-centric plots.

Common themes emerge around emotionally charged films exploring human complexities, morality, and relationships, as seen in comments about visual beauty and engaging dialogue. The individual exhibits a preference for Blu-ray formats, indicating a desire for enhanced audio-visual experiences.

Quality preferences lean towards critically acclaimed films, and the user demonstrates a low price sensitivity, choosing quality over cost. Overall, this suggests a discerning viewer who values artistic merits and prefers films that challenge conventional narratives, with a particular affinity for character-driven stories.

target_interaction.text: I don't play the games, but I loved this movie.  The performances, especially Fassbender, are great; the animus section is appropriately eerie.  I loved the 1492 sequences as well.
